definition: to get an electric shock/to be electrocuted/electric shock
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Lin made her movie debut in the first part of this historical epic.
sentences.chinese: 林志玲是在这部历史大片的第一部分首次“触电”。

sentences.english: Pets may also gnaw on electrical cords for Christmas-tree lights.
sentences.chinese: 宠物也会因啃咬彩灯的电线而触电。

sentences.english: Do not touch that wire or you will electrocute yourself.
sentences.chinese: 不要碰那条电线，否则你会触电而死。

sentences.english: It's best to warn the reader about the potential electric shock in advance.
sentences.chinese: 最好预先警告用户可能出现触电。

sentences.english: A smaller number are electrocuted after contact with power lines outside the home.
sentences.chinese: 一小部分人在接触家外的电线后触电死亡。

sentences.english: He touch a wire and was immediately electrocuted.
sentences.chinese: 他碰到电线，当场触电身亡。

sentences.english: Many are hit by trains or cars, or electrocuted by low-hanging power lines.
sentences.chinese: 许多大象被火车或汽车所撞，或因低挂电力线路触电。

sentences.english: The product poses a risk of electric shock because the leakage of liquids to the inner part of the appliance is possible.
sentences.chinese: 液体易渗漏进机器内部，有令人触电的危险。

sentences.english: To avoid the dangers of people or animals, High-Voltage usually adopts high-line transmission.
sentences.chinese: 为防止人畜触电，高压电一般采用高架线传送。

sentences.english: Make sure the sockets in your house are finger proof.
sentences.chinese: 确保你房中的插座是防触电的。

sentences.english: Be careful with handling the wires, you could get electrocuted.
sentences.chinese: 处理这些电线时当心，不小心你就可能触电。

sentences.english: The leakage protector in electrical training room is an effective measure to prevent physical shock.
sentences.chinese: 电气实训室的漏电保护器是防止人身触电的有效措施。

sentences.english: Against electric shock are reliable earthing of electrical equipment, any part cannot be leakage.
sentences.chinese: 防触电电气设备均要可靠接地，任何部位不能漏电。

sentences.english: The passerby thought he had got an electric shock.
sentences.chinese: 那个过路人以为他触电了呢。

sentences.english: Economize on water and electricity use. Attention on fireproofing. Do not wire the apartment or repair the electricity switch without permission.
sentences.chinese: 不准私自接电源或检修电器开关，以防止触电事故。

sentences.english: First, it was said that she had died from electrocution.
sentences.chinese: 起初，据说，她因触电死亡。

definition: to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
to go off accidentally/to catch fire
